title: The Dawn of God's Dear Sabbath
author: [unclear]

verses.text:
The dawn of God's dear Sabbath
Breaks o'er the earth again,
As some sweet summer morning
After a night of pain;
It comes as cooling showers
To some exhausted land,
As shadow of great rock
Within a weary land.

Lord, we would bring for offering,
Though marred with earthly soil,
A week of earnest labor,
Of steady, faithful toil;
Fair fruits of self-denial,
Of strong, deep love to Thee,
Thy work to make it pure,
In fostering so need, And

And we would bring our burden
Of sin and thoughtful deed,
And with that sorrow mingling,
A steadfast faith, and sure,
That Thou to make it pure.

And with that sorrow mingling,
A steadfast faith, and sure,
For Thee to make it pure.
Then shade of clustered palm trees
'Mid weary wastes of sand,
So few bright laurels won!
